comment.text: Catalyzes the decarboxylation of L-3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine (DOPA) to dopamine, L-5-hydroxytryptophan to serotonin and L-tryptophan to tryptamine.
Catecholamine biosynthesis; dopamine biosynthesis; dopamine from L-tyrosine: step 2/2.

isoform.text: No experimental confirmation available. Gene prediction based on EST data.
No experimental confirmation available. Gene prediction based on EST data.

disease.name: Aromatic L-amino-acid decarboxylase deficiency
disease.description: An inborn error in neurotransmitter metabolism that leads to combined serotonin and catecholamine deficiency. It causes developmental and psychomotor delay, poor feeding, lethargy, ptosis, intermittent hypothermia, gastrointestinal disturbances. The onset is early in infancy and inheritance is autosomal recessive.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the group II decarboxylase family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: P:aminergic neurotransmitter loading into synaptic vesicle
P:cellular response to growth factor stimulus
